name: Swissotel Tallinn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very nice room, great value for money, comfortable bed, nice bathroom with good amenities. Breakfast buffet very good variety, good quality, attentive service.
reviews.title: any time again

reviews.text: wellness area perhaps a bit small, but good quality , clean
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: Swissotel Tallinn has excellent rooms, spectacular views, lovely spa, great restaurants and good service. I would recommend it highly to anyone visiting Tallinn. Front desk, Spa desk and Restaurant waitressess all spoke very good English and were nice and polite, no complaints there. It’s also near the Viru centre and the old town.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Tallinn

reviews.text: Swissotel Tallinn is number two on Tripadvisor for a reason. It is a fairly new hotel, with excellent rooms, spectacular views, lovely spa, great restaurants and good service.
reviews.title: Tallinn's best hotel!

reviews.text: Location: Its situated within a 15 min walk from the Old town and about 10 min ride from the airport (cab hire came about 80EEK, which is 5-6EUR). There is a department store right around the corner of the hotel (Stockman) which has a supermarket on floor 1.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: For this trip, I was torn between the Telegraaf and Swissotel, and decided to go Swissotel because the Telegraaf was twice as expensive due to a great promotion on the Swissotel website.
reviews.title: World-Class Modern Luxury in Tallinn

reviews.text: The hotel far exceeded my expectations in virtually every way. The rooms are large, stylish, immaculate, and comfortable, with large and excellent baths. Noise supression was excellent, both in terms of interior and exterior noise.
reviews.title: Almost faultless hotel in Tallinn

reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the pool and spa areas are beautifully done and carefully maintained. The spa area was actually better than most I've experienced in Europe, even compared to more expensive brands like Regent and Kempinski, so fit it in your schedule if you can.
reviews.title: Very good Hotel- close to the old town

reviews.text: It is true that Tallinn is compact, so much so that I was wanting a little exercise and walked off the ferry and over to the hotel. It takes about 10 minutes to walk into Old Town if you are clicking along pretty well, so the short distance is no issue in pleasant weather. However, if I were there in the biting cold, I would very seriously consider the Telegraaf just to actually be right in the Old Town.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the staffers generally are very young, but they took excellent care of me, were helpful and informative, and I appreciated their energy and charisma.
reviews.title: Affordable luxury indeed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is the highest in Tallinn with great view to the Old Town and sea. It is a good choice!
reviews.title: Elegant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a wonderful weekend and had three spa treatments each (book in advance!) in the stylish spa. We stayed in an executive room and loved the room. The servíce is good and the skyline restaurant serves very nice food. We can really recommend this hotel for a rejuvenating spa weekend.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel - nice spa

reviews.text: We've been there for a week end with my little family. Can t say anything bad about the hotel , brend new, excellent location great staff very friendly ; my little boy of 12 months old was hungry and I get a banana at midnight from the room service in no time, and free of charge with a great diligence from all the staff.
reviews.title: Great !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: if I'll go back to Talinn I definitely will go there and nowhere else !!
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: Great food in the restaurant, the bar on the top floor give a breathtaking view on the harbor and part of the medieval center, breakfast was very good. The swimming pool, hamam and sauna are very clean.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Swissotel Tallinn for 4 nights in July. It's the first time we've stayed at a Swissotel and we'd definitely use this hotel chain again. The hotel was spotlessly clean and very stylish in design.
reviews.title: Very stylish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a corner room on the 14th floor which had floor to ceiling windows on 2 sides with excellent views across to the port and out towards the airport. The room was well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was beautifully decorated with small mosaic tiles in shades of copper and dark brown.
reviews.title: Very nice time in Swissotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had buffet breakfast in Cafe Swiss each morning and it was delicious; the choice of hot and cold food was very good and the quality couldn't be faulted. We also had a cocktail in the bar on the 30th floor one evening.
reviews.title: nice new hotel

reviews.text: We used the pool, sauna and steam room a few times during our stay, although the pool was pretty cold for our British tastes! The whole spa area was again very clean and very stylishly decorated. It was also interesting to have such a great view of the city from the sauna!
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location, less than 10 minutes by taxi from the airport and the ferry port (the taxi fare from each of these places to the hotel was equivalent to about €4). It is also roughly a 10 minute walk through the pleasant shopping area to Tallinn Old Town.
reviews.title: Beautiful, exciting, excellent!!!

description: This contemporary hotel is set in Tallinn's banking district, 800 meters from the Old Town. The hotel offers 238 elegantly appointed guest rooms. Uniquely in Tallinn, the hotel has Executive Floors and a dedicated Swiss Executive Club Lounge. The hotel houses two restaurants and a deli for guests on the run; Pürovel Spa & Sport delivers private fitness and relaxation facilities, including an indoor pool, a gym, a sauna and a steam room.
